Description: Body sherd of large Corinthian black-figured pottery alabastron; exterior: two wide bands; below, decoration consisting of five preserverd rows of double outlined black scales, alternately with red and white central dots.
Curator's comments: The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.6.1894. Payneassigned the Fitzwilliam sherd to the Scale Pattern Group (Payne 1931, 25).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 64, no. A43)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 218, no.19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.147) (Phase 1)
